front.title: RTP payload format for MPEG-4 Audio/Visual streams

abstract.t: This document describes RTP payload formats for the carriage of MPEG-4 Audio and Visual streams[2][3], and an RTCP format for MPEG-4 backward channel messages functionalities[4]. It is based on the RTP/RTCP specification descried in the study on Internet draft for the carriage of MPEG-4 on IP[5]. In this specification, MPEG-4 Audio/Visual bitstreams are directly mapped into RTP packets without using MPEG-4 Systems[6]. The RTP header fields usage and the fragmentation rule for MPEG-4 Visual and Audio bitstreams are specified. It also specifies an RTCP packet usage to carry the MPEG-4 backward channel messages.
